snippet: A group of 400 investors will seek millions in compensation from the central bank for losses incurred when Bankia, the national mortgage lender, devolved into a penny stock.
abstract: Group of investors plans to file unusual lawsuit against Bank of Spain, accusing central bank of failing to warn investors of problems at Bankia, giant mortgage lender whose downfall helped set off banking crisis that obliged Spain to seek bailout from Europe; group, estimated at 400 investors, will seek about $260 million in compensation.
lead_paragraph: A group of 400 investors will seek millions in compensation from the central bank for losses incurred when Bankia, the national mortgage lender, devolved into a penny stock.

headline.seo: Investors in Bankia to Sue Bank of Spain Over Losses
headline.main: Spanish Central Bank to Face Suit Over Bankia Bailout
